meanings.sent1: When I hit my thumb with a hammer, it tumefies and hurts a lot.
meanings.sent2: The bee sting made my hand tumefy and turn red.
meanings.sent3: The balloon tumefies with air until it pops, making a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: Her anger slowly tumefied inside her until she couldn't hold it in anymore.
meanings.sent5: The infection caused his ankle to tumefy to twice its normal size.

meanings.definition: To cause to swell or become swollen.
meanings.sent1: Eating too much salty food can tumefy your fingers in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The injury tumefied his knee, making it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added too much yeast, causing the dough to tumefy rapidly.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to tumefy her heart with joy every time he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special technique to tumefy the paint on the canvas, creating a 3D effect.
